title: Will the Feds Reimburse Me for Not Taking Out Student Loans?
sub_head: First we pay tuition for our children, then as taxpayers we pay for everyone else’s.
body:
What’s the government program to reimburse parents who saved and sacrificed to pay for our children’s college education? (“Student Loan Forbearance—Forever?” Review & Outlook, April 7). Might we file for a government check or at least credit against future tax? We pay twice: for our kids and then for the tax increase to fund debt relief for existing student loans. It doesn’t seem fair.
Rod Noles
